channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Heart-in-mouth moment visitor risks his life to look over 150ft cliff at Birling Gap
item.description: The unknown man, who was not wearing safety equipment, decided to risk his life by hanging off the edge of the Birling Gap cliffs, near Eastbourne, in East Sussex, today.

item.title: Dominic Cummings to make public statement this afternoon
item.description: Dominic Cummings will make a public statement this afternoon to directly address claims he broke lockdown rules by travelling to Durham, Downing Street has confirmed.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Fears of lockdown collapse in heatwave
item.description: With parts of Britain set to bask in temperatures hotter than Athens and Nice and Barcelona, social media users claimed that the PM was sending out the dangerous signal that 'lockdown is finished'.

item.title: Cornwall farmer covers Mercedes in SLURRY after owner parked on his field 'to go to the beach'
item.description: The tractor driver fired muck all over the luxury car near a gate on his farm in Cornwall. A clip of the incident emerged after people flocked to the coast to enjoy the warm weather over the weekend.

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon slams Boris Johnson over Dominic Cummings
item.description: Scotland's First Minister accused Mr Johnson of jeopardising public health messaging by backing his political adviser over alleged repeated trips to Durham during the lockdown.

item.title: French woman is dragged away for refusing to wear a mask
item.description: Police wrestled with a woman who had remonstrated with officers and allegedly bit one of them in angry scenes at a market in Aubenas on Sunday.

item.title: Ex-Durham police chief blasts 'self-privileged' Dominic Cummings and ministers for defending him
item.description: Police in Durham are said to be angry at the government's claim officers did not speak to Dominic Cummings' family after he drove 260 miles to Durham at the end of March.

item.title: Norfolk paedophile, 21, avoids jail after driving 200 miles to abduct schoolgirl, 15
item.description: Charles Fraser-Varney (pictured), 21, travelled from his home in Thetford, Norfolk, to Monmouthshire in Wales to get the schoolgirl for a night together.

item.title: Greater Manchester Police officers 'intimidate' teenage boy
item.description: Five police vans helped detain the boy, then release him, as part of a stop and search in Newton Heath, Manchester, on May 16.

item.title: Six-month-olds see people who imitate them as more friendly
item.description: Babies know when you imitate them - and they perceive it as a sign of friendliness. Swedish experiments suggests that the imitation game is an infant's favourite way of interacting with adults.

item.title: Britain announces more Covid-19 deaths
item.description: NHS England recorded 59 Covid-19 fatalities in hospitals. While Scotland declared three deaths in all settings, Wales seven and Northern Ireland eight.

item.title: Coronavirus: Widower describes being separated from dying wife
item.description: John Wilson from Whitchurch wrote to Buckingham MP Greg Smith to ask what he thinks about the fact that he had to be apart from his dying wife while Dominic Cummings was travelling.

item.title: Cartels are hemorrhaging millions with traffickers forced taking more risks to move cocaine and cash
item.description: From March 1 to May 8, the amount of cash seized by the DEA in the Los Angeles area more than doubled from $4.5 million last year to $10 million in 2020.

item.title: Cemetery under Berlin car park reveals brutality of medieval life
item.description: The remains were unearthed in Petriplatz, near the former St Peter's Church in the town of Colln. Buried between 1047 and 1299 AD, they showed signs of scurvy and tuberculosis.

item.title: More than 25% of all Americans believe bizarre Bill Gates conspiracy theory
item.description: The survey found that 44 per cent of Americans who identified as Republicans believed a conspiracy theory that Bill Gates is planning to use a future Covid-19 vaccine as a way to implant microchips.
item.media:credit: Getty Images for The New York Ti

item.title: Kitten with two faces called Biscuits and Gravy dies just three days after he was born
item.description: Biscuits and Gravy (pictured), the two faced kitten, was born to the King family in Oregon. Despite having a life expectancy of one day, he lived for almost four under the family's loving care.

item.title: Son, 2, asked if he 'could put his hair back on' when it began falling out during cancer treatment
item.description: Jade Faulkner, 25, and her partner Sam Cook, 26, both from Burton upon Trent, Staffordshire, first realised something was wrong when their son Todd developed a lump under his chin.

item.title: Meghan Markle felt 'unfulfilled' and believed 'there was a conspiracy theory against her'
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex, 38, 'was convinced there was a conspiracy against her' and 'felt like an outsider' while she was in the royal family, insiders told Katie Nicholl for The Times.

item.title: Grimes reveals she and Elon Musk had to change baby's name to X Æ A-Xii because of California law
item.description: Their newborn son was initially called X Æ A-12 (pronounced 'Ex Ash A Twelve') but California law prohibits Indo-Arabic numerals in names.

item.title: Jair Bolsonaro is filmed in foul-mouthed rant in cabinet meeting
item.description: Brazilian media counted 31 presidential swear words during the two-hour cabinet meeting, in which Bolsonaro called two governors who imposed lockdowns a 'piece of s**t' and a 'pile of manure'.

item.title: Coronavirus: Seven siblings battle ruling to attend dad's funeral
item.description: Geraldine Hackford, 49, led a campaign against Sheffield City Council to make sure all of her siblings could join her at the funeral of their father, Gerald, who died from a heart blockage on April 16.

item.title: Willie Thorne is unable to feed himself due to sepsis after having treatment for leukaemia
item.description: Thorne was discharged from a hospital in Spain after a period in which he underwent treatment for leukaemia before three blood transfusions and treatment for a virus after his diagnosis in march.

item.title: Princess Elisabeth of Belgium, 18, to attend military academy
item.description: Princess Elisabeth of Belgium, 18, will have to get used to a 'tough' life as she enrolls in Brussels' Royal Military Academy this autumn in preparation for her role as Belgium's future queen.

item.title: Removing soft toys from classrooms is too 'extreme', government expert warns
item.description: Professor Robert Dingwall, from Nottingham University, warned the measures were 'extreme' and risked making children 'miserable' when they are finally allowed back into class.

item.title: Princess Beatrice announces the Oscar's Book Prize
item.description: Princess Beatrice, 31, who was due to get married on Friday in London but cancelled the wedding amid the coronavirus pandemic, appeared in a clip for her patronage Oscar's Book Prize.

item.title: CofE may refuse to work with government after Cummings defence
item.description: Bishops have reacted with fury on social media, saying Mr Johnson's defence of Cummings is an 'insult' and that he has 'no respect for the people.'

item.title: Coronavirus UK: NHS hospital in Somerset sees surge in cases
item.description: Weston General Hospital in Weston-super-Mare said today it could not take any more admissions including into A&E.

item.title: Brian May reveals he suffered heart attack after injury
item.description: The Queen guitarist was recovering from a ripped muscle and trapped nerve as a result of a gardening injury, when he suffered a heart attack. The rocker was shocked as he is in good health.

item.title: Simon McCoy slams BBC colleague Gary Lineker for impartiality
item.description: The news anchor slammed the sports pundit after Lineker sounded off about Boris Johnson's coronavirus briefing last night as the PM defended his top aide in Downing Street.

item.title: Dominic Cummings Scandal: British Press divided over response
item.description: Britain's newspapers are showing mixed views in response to Boris Johnson's backings of Dominic Cummings on Sunday night, while some call for the top aide to resign, others only call for a review.

item.title: Retired teacher holds Dominic Cummings' fate in his hands after spotting him 30 MILES from home
item.description: Robin Lees and his walk in Barnard Castle on April 12 could prove pivotal in forcing the Prime Minister's hand despite his astonishing defence of his friend, adviser and enforcer last night.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle fans unveil 'Archie's woods' after campaign for Sussex Great Forest
item.description: Prince Harry, 35, and Meghan Markle, 38, fans have revealed how they transformed a 'once abandoned farm in upstate New York' with hundreds of trees planted in the couple's name.

item.title: No10 tweets reminder that Britons should 'keep 6ft apart from people you don't live with'
item.description: Furious Britons have mocked the Government for telling to keep their distance after Prime Minister Boris Johnson defended his top aide for going to Durham in lockdown.

item.title: NHS won't be the service people had previously, health chief says
item.description: Saffron Cordery, deputy chief executive of NHS Providers - which represents hospital organisations - says resuming operations across the NHS will happen 'relatively slowly'.

item.title: Spain's tourism minister says Brits SHOULD book holidays for July
item.description: Reyes Maroto, Spain's tourism minister, urged foreigners to book holidays starting from July, saying that she anticipates rules requiring new arrivals to quarantine for 14 days to be dropped by then.

item.title: JK Rowling offers to pay salary of mystery Civil Service tweeter calling Boris Johnson 'arrogant'
item.description: Author J.K. Rowling has offered to reward the person who responded to Boris Johnson's Downing Street briefing last night with a tweet slamming him for sticking up for Dominic Cummings.

item.title: Giving plants 'good' bacteria could help them fight disease
item.description: UK researchers say they are developing beneficial bacteria for plants that supports their immune systems in a similar way to positive gut bacteria in humans.

item.title: Former Roma youth player Joseph Bouasse Perfection dies aged 21
item.description: The Cameroonian midfielder trained alongside the likes of Daniele de Rossi and Francesco Totti during his time in the Italian capital and featured 11 times in the club's youth team.

item.title: Cyclists pedal the wrong way into oncoming traffic
item.description: Arkadiusz Gwóźdź was driving a heavy goods vehicle in Portsmouth when three cyclists pedalled towards him. He had to blast his horn to stop them from colliding with him.

item.title: Mike Tindall reveals how he has a 'whole new respect for teachers' after homeschooling his daughter
item.description: Mike Tindall, 41, who shares six-year-old Mia and Lena, one, with Zara Tindall, 39, told Hello! about family life on Princess Anne's Gloucestershire estate.

item.title: Urgent warning after baby is strangled to death by a blind cord
item.description: Rifky Grossberger stood up in her cot and became caught in the looped cable at her parents' home in Hackney, North London. Pictured is an example of a looped cable.

item.title: Rishi Sunak 'working on Project Birch business bailout'
item.description: Rishi Sunak is developing a business bailout package which would see the Government act as lender of 'last resort' to key UK firms to stop them from going under because of the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: First white stork chicks born in Britain for 600 years peer out of their nest for first time
item.description: Pictures show the moment a parent arrives at its nest at Knepp Castle near Horsham, West Sussex - with the chicks - born earlier this month thanks to the White Stork Project - clearly visible.

item.title: Ivanka Trump slammed in India after she praised girl, 15, who cycled 750 miles home carrying father
item.description: Jyoti Kumari, 15, carried her father Mohan Paswan on the back of her bicycle for 750 miles over a week in an attempt to get home from Gurugram, northern India, as they ran low on food as Migrant workers.

item.title: British Airways passengers complain about packed flights in Europe
item.description: Images emerged on Twitter of a packed BA flight with passengers appearing to be seated directly next to each other rather than the government-advised two metres apart.

item.title: Travellers descend on Sandbanks car park while flouting lockdown rules
item.description: Around ten motorhomes descended on a car park at the exclusive peninsula in Poole. One group of men ignored social distancing rules and sat at an outdoor table, with crates of Corona beer.

item.title: Police officer reinstated after being taken off duty because boy falsely claimed he had punched him
item.description: PC Paul Evans, 52, from Bridgend, South Wales, was taken off duty for two years after a 14-year-old boy falsely accused the officer of grabbing his throat and punching him three times in the face.

item.title: Three in 10 negative coronavirus tests may be wrong, a doctors' union warns
item.description: The Hospital Consultants and Specialists Association (HCSA) says between two and three Britons who are positive for the virus test negative.

item.title: Mother shares snap of her car floor covered in paint
item.description: Sarah Hunt, from Lancashire, shared her horror after realising a tub of paint had spilled all over her car.

item.title: Queen upsets the locals at Sandringham by building half-mile 'eyesore' earth bank
item.description: Her Royal Highness, 94, had the 1,000-metre kerb erected at the royal estate near King's Lynn, Norfolk. The foot-high mound has prevented visitors from parking along the grass verge near the house.

item.title: Polar bear plays with zoo worker through glass of his aquarium in Belgium
item.description: The unlikely friends play together at the Land of the Cold, an Arctic world at the Pairi Daiza zoo in Brugelette, western Belgium. The zoo has one of the largest polar bear enclosures in the world.

item.title: Doctor who thinks washing is bad for your health insists he doesn't smell
item.description: Dr James Hamblin, from New York, appeared on This Morning today where he claimed that washing off the 'millions of microbes' all over your skin could be detrimental to your health.

item.title: Mother reveals how she is 'dreading' her in-laws moving in next door
item.description: Posting anonymously on the British parenting site Mumsnet, the woman revealed how her mother and father-in-law have been renovating the house next door and will be moving in.

item.title: Tesco stocks white eggs for the first time in more than 40 years to meet unprecedented demand
item.description: The eggs - which are used in McDonald's breakfast McMuffins - will cost the same as the brown free-range equivalent, starting from 89p for a box of six medium eggs.

item.title: Paralysed woman sadly passes away two years after her dream wedding to 'perfect man'
item.description: Alicia Willow-Clarke, of Cardiff, who was left paraplegic after a childhood accident, died from kidney failure last week, her husband Kevin, also 36, said today.

item.title: Gavin Williamson says it will be 'a long journey' to get schools back to normal
item.description: The Education Secretary acknowledged that there would be 'initial nervousness' from parents, but on top of missing classes children were also missing 'social interaction' with friends.

item.title: Scientists test substance found buried with warrior and his sword in 221BC
item.description: Researchers with the Sanmenxia Archaeology Institute in Central China's Henan Province announced the discovery of the intact grave on May 21.

item.title: Bestselling author Jane Fallon, reveals the saying 'big girl pants' makes her cringe
item.description: Dozens of people around the world shared their biggest bug bears after British author Jane Fallon revealed hers is an adult woman saying 'big girl pants'.

item.title: Serial rapist dubbed 'the Beast of Kavos' breaks his back plunging 100ft into a ravine
item.description: Dimitris Aspiotis, 47, who preyed on seven British holidaymakers, fractured his leg, hip and spine and ruptured a kidney when he fell from a cliff in Lefkimmi last Friday.

item.title: Baffled onlookers describe how a 'black ring' UFO darted over hippy town for 40 MINUTES
item.description: Locals from Nimbin in far north New South Wales reported a mysterious black ring hovering in the sky on Wednesday afternoon.

item.title: New Zealand is rattled by a massive 5.7 magnitude earthquake
item.description: The quake struck near Wellington, on New Zealand's North Island at 7.53am on Monday.

item.title: 'Once-in-a-decade' storm lashes Western Australia while east coast is battered by 10m waves
item.description: About 62,000 properties across Western Australia have been left without power over the past two days - as the state's south bears the brunt of the remnants of ex-tropical cyclone Mangga.

item.title: Princess Eugenie thanks artists who have brought messages of solidarity amid coronavirus pandemic
item.description: Princess Eugenie, 30, took to Instagram and re-shared American artist Hank Willis Thomas's post thanking global artists for bringing messages of public safety to Times Square.

item.title: Killing Eve fans 'tear up' as Eve and Villanelle come seconds from being reunited
item.description: SPOILER: Villanelle (Jodie Comer) and Eve (Sandra Oh) were moments from being reunited before the train pulled away from a Scottish train station in Killing Eve - and they had to wave goodbye instead.

item.title: Richard Branson's Virgin Orbit set to take to sky as soon as 6pm tonight
item.description: Rocket is expected to ignite its engines after launching from the Mojave Air and Space Port in California between 6pm and 10pm tonight. Yesterday's plan cancelled due to a faulty sensor.

item.title: Making a killing: The British businessmen linked to 'big game' trophy hunting
item.description: Among the trophy hunters is David Watt, 72, who is the international booking co-ordinator for Nduna Hunting Safari in South Africa and allows his clients to shoot a host of wildlife animals.

item.title: NASA seeks participants for eight-month isolation study
item.description: In a nod to the current virus pandemic, the space agency is on the hunt for volunteers for a 'social isolation' mission that simulates the psychological effects of confinement.

item.title: Hundreds of surfers take to huge waves at Sydney's beaches in the one of the swells of the year
item.description: The monster southerly swell rolled into Australia's east coast on Friday, with keen board riders scoring powerful waves with favourable winds throughout NSW in classic autumn surf conditions.

item.title: Mother tigress becomes embroiled in a fierce duel with her DAUGHTER
item.description: The dramatic moment between the massive tigers unfolded in an open, lush green area at the Ranthambore National Park in western state of Rajasthan in India.

item.title: Doctor says he will QUIT if Dominic Cummings does not go
item.description: Dominic Pimenta told Good Morning Britain that he's ready to resign if Cummings stays in his position as the top Government aide after travelling from London to Durham in lockdown.

item.title: DOMINIC LAWSON: Clean undies, candles... An unmissable guide to life after lockdown
item.description: DOMINIC LAWSON: As Britons prepare for the end of lockdown, after months of isolation at home, I thought it might be helpful to offer a guide to various terms which have fallen into disuse.

item.title: Prince Andrew 'grabbed Virginia Roberts' bottom on her during visit to "paedophile island"
item.description: The makers of the documentary talk to Steve Scully who claims he saw Prince Andrew kissing Miss Roberts on the Caribbean Island.

item.title: The Queen 'noted Archie has Prince Harry's red hair' during great grandson's birthday zoom
item.description: The Queen, who is currently living in Windsor Castle, 'noted that Archie, one, has Prince Harry's, 35, red hair' while video-calling the Sussexes on her 94th birthday, Katie Nicholl told The TImes.

item.title: Wife of coronavirus patient, 69, says it was 'horrendous' she was unable to be with him
item.description: On Good Morning Britain today, Mary Harvey admitted it was 'horrendous' not being able to see husband Brian Harvey, 69, as he spent weeks in intensive care with COVID-19.

item.title: Did pilots FORGET to put wheels down on doomed PIA 8303?
item.description: Captain Sajjad Gull, who was at the controls of doomed Pakistan Airlines Flight 8303 when it crashed on Friday killing 97, may have forgotten to put the wheels down when landing, experts said.

item.title: Adorable moment tiny cygnets struggle to climb up kerb as they cross road
item.description: Swans George and Zelda exhibited perfect co-parenting when they slowly walked their cygnets across a road in Cheltenham. Onlookers stood in the middle of the road to stop any traffic.

item.title: How unexpected items are fuelling YOUR junk food cravings
item.description: London-based nutritionist Tamara Willner tells FEMAIL about the unexpected food fuelling your bad habits - including sauces, cereal bars and even soups.

item.title: Footballers warned of dangers of mixing sleeping pills with alcohol
item.description: Sleeping pills are widely available from doctors or online and do not feature on the World Anti-Doping Agency's [WADA] list of banned substances. Mixed with alcohol, they produce an intoxicating effect.

item.title: 'I am deeply grateful': Archbishop of Canterbury thanks Prince William for help in facing depression
item.description: The Archbishop of Canterbury yesterday thanked Prince William for helping him pull through his recent battle with depression. Justin Welby said that he 'encouraged him to seek help'.

item.title: Cat-lover builds a cat patio on his kitchen window for only £75
item.description: Georgia Hook, from Dumfries, revealed how her partner built the 'catio' using old repurposed items as well as £75 worth of new material so that their cats could enjoy the fresh air.

item.title: Stealing meat from hungry lions? That's real bravado! Christopher Stevens reviews the weekend's TV
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: Striding across the bristling swamp-grass of the Okavango Delta in Botswana, in Walking With Elephants, Levison Wood insisted on taking his boots off, going barefoot.

item.title: Hazmat suit-clad burglar is caught trying to steal a £5million Bansky artwork from an NHS hospital
item.description: Bansky donated the painting titled 'Game Changer' to Southampton General Hospital on May 6. Just two days later, a man was seen on CCTV as he skulked around in front of the artwork.

item.title: Mother shares her slow-cooked creamy nachos recipe
item.description: US-based Tabitha Harris Miller shared her recipe for creamy nachos using a slow-cooker, cans of soup and black beans. She said it took four to six hours to cook, or two to three if left on high.

item.title: James Reed warns of job losses 'tsunami' on 'day of reckoning' when furlough ends
item.description: The owner of Reed has warned job losses could sweep across the country once the government's furlough scheme ends at the ends of October. More than 6m people have signed up to the scheme.

item.title: Body language experts reveal the tricks that make you look confident INSTANTLY
item.description: If you want to appear more confident and 'powerful' at work and in social situations, adjusting your body language could be the key to your success.

item.title: Single mum transforms kitchen her kitchen for just £90 using paint and stencil
item.description: Single mother Carly Thomas, from Telford, Shropshire, revealed how she transformed her kitchen for under £100, using her DIY skills and budget buys bought during lockdown.

item.title: Husband of train worker who died from coronavirus after being spat on reveals pain
item.description: Lusamba Katalay revealed how losing Belly Mujinga has destroyed his world and that of his 11-year-old daughter after she died at Barnet Hospital.

item.title: Ghost hunters were spooked out of 'haunted' Louisiana house being given away for free
item.description: Cindy Parr and Greg Matlock claim it is the worst house they have stayed in after 20 years of hunting ghosts in Louisiana, due to the events that took place recently.

item.title: GOP lawmaker demands Trump STOP promoting Joe Scarborough murder conspiracy theory
item.description: Illinois Rep. Adam Kinzinger tweeted President Trump Sunday about the 'completely unfounded conspiracy'. 'Just stop. Stop spreading it, stop creating paranoia. It will destroy us,' he said.

item.title: Lance Armstrong bought dinner for entire table of people after they screamed 'f****** cheater'
item.description: The first episode of the ESPN documentary 'LANCE,' which aired nationwide on Sunday, began with Armstrong repeating the F-word while flipping the bird.

item.title: Check out these delicious recipes from the Hairy Bikers that could save your life
item.description: As statistics reveal a higher mortality rate from coronavirus for those who are obese or have type 2 diabetes, Si King and Dave Myers reveal how their new cookbook may help save yours

item.title: STEPHEN GLOVER: The British people have the right to expect better from the Prime Minister
item.description: STEPHEN GLOVER: Despite Mr Johnson's generalised defence of him last night, it is very hard to conclude that he didn't breach the lockdown on at least two separate occasions.

item.title: 130 people claim they are Jeffrey Epstein's children and are entitled to his $635 million estate
item.description: A genealogical website Epsteinheirs.com set up by Morse Genealogical Services has heard from 130 people who claim they are heirs to Jeffrey Epstein's $635 million estate.

item.title: Makeup artist Julia Stronach, 33, creates age-defying transformation for her aunt Sandra
item.description: Julia Stronach, 33, from Aberdeen in northeast Scotland, shaved years off her 80-year-old aunt Sandra's face with sheer foundation, matte and shimmered eyeshadow and orange concealer.

item.title: Man, 34, Is sixth person charged with murder of 19-year-old law student Aya Hachem in Blackburn
item.description: A 34-year-old man is now the sixth person charged by police for the murder of 19-year-old law student Aya Hachem. Four other men and a woman have also been charged by police already.

item.title: Oxford students doing exams on videolink say invigilators should NOT see their 'private space'
item.description: Oxford University's Faculty of Classics confirmed that exams would be taken over Microsoft Teams. All invigilators will undergo a mandatory 'camera sweep of the room' before the test starts.
